intro: Strychnos schunkei, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are attractive to birds, aiding in seed dispersal. It is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
